DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course Regional Lymph Node Surgery Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Describes the removal, biopsy or aspiration of regional lymph node(s) at the time of surgery of the primary site or during a separate surgical event at all facilities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course Regional Lymph Node Surgery
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal, biopsy or aspiration of regional lymph node(s) at the time of surgery of the primary site or during a separate surgical event at all facilities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.:A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.
The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Regional Lymph Node Surgery Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest._A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: 4 or more regional lymph nodes removed

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: 4 or more regional lymph nodes removed

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Number of regional lymph nodes removed unknown, not stated; regional lymph nodes removed, NOS

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Number of regional lymph nodes removed unknown, not stated; regional lymph nodes removed, NOS

Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.
